security_audit.summary: This is a pure mathematical calculator skill that performs arithmetic operations. It uses Python eval() with restricted builtins ({__builtins__: {}) and regex validation to ensure only safe mathematical characters are processed. No network access, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Need quick answers for mathematical calculations. This skill performs basic and complex math operations through simple natural language requests.
actual_capabilities: Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division operations
Evaluate complex expressions with parentheses for order of operations
Handle floating-point results for division operations
Return error messages for invalid expressions and division by zero
limitations: Does not support variables or custom functions
Cannot perform trigonometric or logarithmic calculations
Expressions must be provided in linear format without special characters
Limited to basic arithmetic and power operations only

use_cases.title: Homework helper
use_cases.description: Quickly verify math homework answers or calculate complex expressions during study sessions

use_cases.title: Quick calculations
use_cases.description: Perform quick arithmetic checks or evaluate mathematical expressions without switching tools

use_cases.title: Daily math tasks
use_cases.description: Calculate budgets, measurements, or simple data analysis tasks during workflows

best_practices: Use parentheses to clarify order of operations in complex expressions
State the calculation clearly with natural language context
Verify results for critical calculations with alternative methods
anti_patterns: Using variables in expressions without defined support
Requesting functions like sqrt(), sin(), or log() which are not supported
Providing expressions with special characters or system commands

faq.question: What operations does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports addition (+), subtraction (-), multiplication (*), division (/), and exponentiation (** or ^).

faq.question: What is the maximum number size?
faq.answer: Uses Python float precision. Handles very large numbers but may lose precision beyond 15-17 digits.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Works as a standalone skill. Results can be used in prompts for other skills manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill processes expressions locally in the Python environment without network or file access.

faq.question: Why did my calculation fail?
faq.answer: Common causes include division by zero, unsupported characters, or expressions with variables or functions.

faq.question: How is this different from a regular calculator?
faq.answer: Accessed through natural language prompts in AI assistants without leaving your conversational context.
